alert.note: Alert for Central Laramie County; Central Laramie Range and Southwest Platte County; East Platte County; Goshen County; South Laramie Range Foothills (Wyoming) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Cheyenne (Southeastern Wyoming and Western Nebraska)
info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued July 14 at 10:30PM MDT by NWS Cheyenne
info.description: ...A strong thunderstorm will impact portions of southwestern Goshen, north central Laramie and south central Platte Counties through 1100 PM MDT... At 1030 PM MDT, Doppler radar was tracking a strong thunderstorm 10 miles southwest of Chugwater, or 29 miles south of Wheatland, moving southeast at 40 mph. HAZARD...Winds in excess of 30 mph and penny size hail. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Minor damage to outdoor objects is possible. This storm will remain over mainly rural areas of southwestern Goshen, north central Laramie and south central Platte Counties. This includes Interstate 25 in Wyoming between mile markers 33 and 51. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.75 IN MAX WIND GUST...30 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building.

area.areaDesc: Central Laramie County; Central Laramie Range and Southwest Platte County; East Platte County; Goshen County; South Laramie Range Foothills
